questions.text: A 37-year-old woman with a SLE presents for a routine follow up visit. She is compliant with her medication regimen containing hydroxychloroquine. An old friend of hers from high school recently passed away from a sudden pulmonary embolism, and the situation made her worried. She asks if she is at risk for a blood clot. What should you tell her?

options.label: A
options.text: Her risk of a thromboembolism is only elevated if she tests positive for antiphospholipid antibodies, which is only seen in 10% of lupus patients.

options.label: B
options.text: Her risk of a thromboembolism is only elevated if she tests positive for antiphospholipid antibodies, which is seen in about one-third of lupus patients.

options.label: C
options.text: Having SLE even without antiphospholipid antibodies is a significant risk factor for developing a blood clot

options.label: D
options.text: The longer one has had SLE, the higher the risk for a thromboembolism.

questions.correct_answer: C. Having SLE even without antiphospholipid antibodies is a significant risk factor for developing a blood clot
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Having SLE even without antiphospholipid antibodies is a significant risk factor for developing a blood clot

questions.text: By which of the following mechanisms can hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis increase the risk of osteoporosis in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Uncouples bone remodeling and shortens bone remodeling cycle

options.label: C
options.text: Release of tumor necrosis factor a and interleukins IL-1 and IL-6

questions.correct_answer: B. Uncouples bone remodeling and shortens bone remodeling cycle
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Uncouples bone remodeling and shortens bone remodeling cycle

questions.text: A 37-year-old software engineer presents to the clinic with concerns about his "overwhelming sexual urges." He describes an insatiable need for sexual gratification, leading him to masturbate multiple times a day, even during short breaks at work. This has led to embarrassing situations, including nearly being caught by a colleague. He also admits to frequenting explicit websites daily, often in inappropriate settings. Despite feeling guilty and trying to control these urges, he feels powerless over them. He's been married for 10 years, and though he's intimate with his wife almost daily, he still can't curb his urges. Considering his distress and impairment in daily functioning, which of the following medications would be the most appropriate initial treatment?

A 5-year-old male child presents to the pediatric clinic with complaints of recurrent headaches, vomiting. Parents report that the headaches have been progressively worsening over the past few weeks, and the vomiting episodes are occurring almost daily. They are also concerned about the child's developmental delay, noting a significant loss of previously acquired skills such as speaking in full sentences and walking steadily. On physical examination, the child's head circumference is noted to be above the 97th percentile for his age, with a tense and bulging anterior fontanelle. The child exhibits the "sunsetting" sign, where the sclera is visible above the irises when looking downward. Additionally, he has an unsteady gait and difficulty walking without support. MRI is shown here. What is the likely cause of hydrocephalus?
Which of the following findings suggest a diagnosis of psoriatic arthritis in a patient with psoriasis, dactylitis, and tenderness in the sacroiliac joints?

options.label: D
options.text: Involvement of only the proximal interphalangeal joints of a digit

questions.correct_answer: B. Mouse ear sign on X-ray
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Mouse ear sign on X-ray

questions.text: This device shown in the image is used in:
questions.correct_answer: A. Men with suspected urethral stricture
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Men with suspected urethral stricture

questions.text: What is the next step in management of a 32-year-old woman with a 5-year history of primary infertility with bilateral tubal block seen at cornua on hysterosalpingogram?

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat examination on a later date with pre-treatment with ibuprofen

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeat examination on a later date with pre-treatment with ibuprofen
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Repeat examination on a later date with pre-treatment with ibuprofen

questions.text: When performing flexor tendon repair, which of the following pulleys must be preserved?
A patient is diagnosed with moderate psoriatic arthritis resistant to NSAIDs. Which of the following is recommended as first line therapy to prevent joint destruction?
A 34-year-old man presents with a 3-month history of knee pain, with an inability to squat. The most likely diagnosis is?

A 32-year-old female presents to the dermatology clinic concerned about white patches on her skin that she noticed since childhood. Physical examination reveals depigmented patches with a symmetrical distribution, especially prominent on the ventral aspect of her body and mid-forehead. White forelock is noted as shown in the image below. She mentions that her grandfather had similar patches since his birth. She also reports that a cousin on her father's side has been recently diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. Given the patient's history and clinical presentation, which of the following describes the underlying cause of her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: A polygenic disorder with progressive depigmentation.

options.label: B
options.text: An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.

options.label: C
options.text: An autoimmune condition with progressive depigmentation.

options.label: D
options.text: A sporadic condition without a genetic link.

questions.correct_answer: B. An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.

questions.text: An 84-year-old woman with a history of hypertension and spinal stenosis who was noted to have a sudden-onset tachycardia during preoperative evaluation. The patient received intravenous verapamil at which time she converted to normal sinus rhythm. Extended-release verapamil was continued without further dysrhythmia recurrence. What is the likely diagnosis based on the ECG shown below?

In a romantic Bollywood scene, Alia Bhatt finds herself utterly captivated and literally blown away by Ranbir Kapoor's striking good looks. Overcome by his charm, she finds herself breathless and in need of some assistance to catch her breath. Swiftly, a medical oxygen cylinder is brought to her aid, ensuring she can continue the scene in good health. What is color of medical oxygen cylinder?

options.label: B
options.text: Grey body with black and white shoulder

questions.correct_answer: C. Black body with white shoulder
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Black body with white shoulder

questions.text: A patient is treated with cisplatin and bleomycin and develops renal failure. Which of the following is a characteristic of renal failure that may occur specifically when cisplatin is given with bleomycin?

A 6-year-old child presents with a history of recurrent episodes of joint pain, swelling, and rash. The rash appears as erythematous, scaly plaques over the cheeks and buttocks. The child's parents mention that these symptoms seem to flare up periodically and are associated with fever. Physical examination reveals synovitis in multiple joints, and eye examination shows uveitis. Genetic testing is performed, revealing a mutation in the NOD2 gene. Which of the following conditions is the most likely diagnosis?

In the blockbuster Bollywood movie "Jawaan", Shahrukh Khan plays a daring anaesthesiologist. In a dramatic scene, he swiftly uses the device given in the picture below to secure the airway of a fellow spy who experiences respiratory distress during a high-stakes mission. This heroic medical intervention allows them to escape a precarious situation and proceed with their mission, showcasing medical knowledge in action on the big screen. Which of these is not an advantage of this device?

options.label: D
options.text: Can be used with cervical injuries

questions.text: When compared to the non-dominant side, which of the following shoulder motions is characteristically decreased in the throwing arm of athletes?
Identify the incorrect statement about acute appendicitis:

options.label: A
options.text: Pain is intermittent, colicky and periumbilical

options.label: B
options.text: Fever is usually low grade and continuous

options.label: C
options.text: Anorexia is infrequently seen in children

options.label: D
options.text: Positive family history is seen in 1/3rd of patients

questions.correct_answer: C. Anorexia is infrequently seen in children
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Anorexia is infrequently seen in children

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:
A patient with metastatic prostate cancer develops hypocalcemia during treatment with a bone antiresorptive agent. Which of the following agents is most likely to result in hypocalcemia?

A patient presented with history of colicky abdominal pain and vomiting 5 years after a undergoing a Roux-en-Y gastric bypass for weight loss. Abdominal examination was unremarkable, barring some vague tenderness. CECT scan showed dilated small bowel loops. A decision to perform diagnostic laparotomy was made. Laparotomy revealed gangrenous small bowel about 4 feet in length. What is the probable diagnosis?

A therapist observes distinct patterns in her sessions with a 35-year-old woman who has a turbulent history with relationships. Initially, the woman sings praises about the therapist, declaring her as the best thing that's happened to her. However, after a few sessions, she arrives agitated, accusing the therapist of not genuinely wanting to help her. These extreme shifts in perception occur frequently, creating a turbulent therapeutic environment. Which defense mechanism is predominantly being exhibited by this patient?

In an action-packed medical drama, actress Nora Fatehi portrays a skilled neurologist performing a critical procedure. The scene intensifies as she meticulously performs a lumbar puncture on a patient to diagnose a mysterious condition. The audience is on the edge of their seats as Nora, maintaining her composure, feels a snap just before entering the epidural space, and successfully completes the procedure, adding a layer of medical intrigue to the movie. This is due to piercing of which structure?

A 19-year-old male student who recently attended a large university gathering is admitted to the emergency department. Over the past week, he developed a headache that was initially mild but progressively intensified. He also complains of fatigue, malaise, and muscle pain. He has a persistent cough, sore throat, and a high-grade fever for the past 4 days. On examination, his vital signs show a fever of 103°F and increased heart rate. Petechiae are noted spread over his extremities and trunk. Lumbar puncture shows increased white blood cells with a predominance of neutrophils. Gram stain reveals gram-negative diplococci. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 63-year-old previously healthy woman with no significant medical history develops an abnormal EKG following the repair of a closed femur fracture sustained in a high-speed motor vehicle crash. The procedure was notable for mild tachycardia and hypotension but was otherwise uncomplicated. ECG shows 1-2 mm ST elevations in leads V2-V4 and deep T-wave inversions in V5, V6, and aVL. Serum troponin is 0.8. The patient undergoes an emergent coronary angiography, which reveals no evidence of acute thrombus formation. Which of the following additional findings is likely present?

options.label: D
options.text: Akinetic LV apex and mid-ventricular segments

questions.correct_answer: D. Akinetic LV apex and mid-ventricular segments
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Akinetic LV apex and mid-ventricular segments

questions.text: Following radical esophagectomy, patient develops breathlessness on post-operative day 5 (POD-5). Chest examination shows reduced air entry on left hemithorax. O2 supplementation is started, and patient is shifted for chest X ray. Chest x ray reveal moderate left sided pleural effusion. Intercostal drain is inserted, fluid is drained as shown. You will send this fluid for what assessment for confirming diagnosis?
According to European Society classification, an inguinal hernia of size 6 cm extending to the scrotum and deep ring occlusion test positive, with defect of size 3 cm is described as:
Which of the following mutations is associated with Crohn’s disease related primary small bowel adenocarcinoma?
questions.explanation: Ans. A. p53 mutations are associated with Crohn’s disease-associated small bowel adenocarcinoma.

questions.text: Although the small bowel accounts for 75% of the length and over 90% of the surface area of the gastrointestinal tract, small bowel neoplasms only account for approximately 3% of gastrointestinal cancers. Which of the following is not a possible protective mechanism in the small bowel that accounts for the relatively low rate of adenocarcinoma in the small bowel compared to the colon?

options.label: A
options.text: Shorter transit times through the small bowel

options.label: B
options.text: Lower density of aerophilic gram-positive bacteria in the small bowel

options.label: C
options.text: Lower concentration of gram-negative bacteria in the small bowel

options.label: D
options.text: Higher concentration of microsomal enzymes in small bowel epithelia

questions.correct_answer: D. Higher concentration of microsomal enzymes in small bowel epithelia
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Higher concentration of microsomal enzymes in small bowel epithelia

questions.text: A 23-year-old man with HL was treated successfully with the ABVD regimen. Which of the following drugs used in the treatment of this patient is cell cycle specific?
